alert.note: Alert for Custer; Dewey; Ellis (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 07 at 8:37AM CDT until July 11 at 1:00PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 AM CDT THIS MORNING... ...REPLACES FLASH FLOOD WARNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northwest and western Oklahoma, including the following counties, in northwest Oklahoma, Dewey and Ellis. In western Oklahoma, Custer and Roger Mills. * WHEN...Until 1000 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 836 AM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Leedey, Camargo, Angora and Roll. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
